channel.title: Literacy Matters: Empowered Conversations
channel.description: Uncover early literacy secrets with Dr. Cheryl Lundy Swift & experts, offering monthly insights, tips, and perspectives to transform your teaching.
channel.itunes:author: Learning Without Tears
channel.itunes:summary: Join Dr. Cheryl Lundy Swift, director of Professional Learning, as she meets with industry professionals and explores today's early literacy landscape and beyond.

item.title: S3E4. Maya Payne Smart - Beyond Family Literacy Night
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Maya Payne Smart, a literacy advocate and author, emphasizes family engagement and strong school-family partnerships as crucial for early literacy development. She highlights interactions and community support as key strategies for parents to nurture proficient readers.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, handwriting, cursive, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.title: S3E3. Kareem Weaver - Love Is a Lesson Plan-Teaching That Counts
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Kareem Weaver, Co-Founder of FULCRUM, shares insights into championing children's literacy through the Science of Reading.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, handwriting, cursive, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.title: S3E2. Dr. Tim Shanahan - Teaching Reading with Grade-Level Texts
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Dr. Tim Shanahan shares insights on using grade-level texts to elevate reading instruction and meet diverse learning challenges.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, handwriting, cursive, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.title: S3E1. Dr. Christina Bretz and Dr. Suzanne Asherson - Cursive Is Not a Frill-It's a Life Skill
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Drs. Christina Bretz and Suzanne Asherson advocate for cursive writing's role in modern education, emphasizing its lifelong benefits.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, handwriting, cursive, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.title: S2E15. Dr. Shayne Piasta - Four Key Components of Teaching Alphabetic Knowledge
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Dr. Shayne Piasta breaks down alphabetic knowledge teaching, focusing on the sequence and pacing of letter learning.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.title: S2E14. Tim Cusack and Vince Bustamante - Pathways to Principalship
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Tim Cusack and Vince Bustamante outline pathways to leadership in education, highlighting mentorship's role in developing school leaders.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.title: S2E13. Keisha Smith-Carrington - The Connection Between Literacy Growth and Self-Worth
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Keisha Smith-Carrington discusses boosting literacy and self-worth by connecting emotionally with students.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.title: S2E12. Dr. Gravity Goldberg - The Instructor-Student Paradox
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Dr. Gravity Goldberg reveals how embracing student challenges fosters independence, shifting the teaching paradigm.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.title: S2E11. Leah Mermelstein and Kelly Cartwright - The Active View of Reading
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Kelly Cartwright and Leah Mermelstein explore the multifaceted process of reading, aligning teaching with the science of reading.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.title: S2E10. Lester Laminack - Slow Brew Read-Alouds
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Lester Laminack shares the power of read-alouds to bolster comprehension, detailing three strategic approaches for educators.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Discover the impact of language on children's thinking and learning with Lily Howard Scott's transformative phrases.

item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Dana Clark explores how picture books foster comprehension and empathy, enhancing students' reading experiences.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.itunes:summary: Dr. Eliza Braden discusses "revolutionary love" in teaching, offering strategies for creating an inclusive, supportive classroom culture.

item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Dr. Miriam Ortiz provides strategies for addressing diverse student learning needs, ensuring every child finds success in the classroom.

item.title: S1E8. Michelle Paster - Reading Comprehension
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Michelle Paster, M.A., the executive director of LearningWorks, joins Cheryl to address the impact of disrupted learning on reading comprehension and visual strategies that can help your students get back on track.

item.title: S1E7. Dr. Julia Lindsey - Unlocking the Power of Decodable Texts
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Learn from Dr. Julia Lindsey about maximizing decodable texts in the classroom to boost word recognition and fluency.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.title: S1E6. Dr. Miriam Ortiz - Classroom Success for the Year Ahead
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Dr. Miriam Ortiz, owner and chief consultant of K12 Matters, sits with Cheryl to share advice for making the start of the school year a success. Hear tips for setting clear objectives, using formative assessments at the beginning and throughout the year, and targeting your instruction to the needs of your classroom.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.title: S1E5. Kit Mohr - Embracing the Benefits of Fluent Handwriting
item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Kathleen Mohr discusses the significance of handwriting fluency in early literacy development, drawing on her extensive educational experience.
item.itunes:keywords: schools, learning, K-5, education, literacy, inspirational, teachers, occupational therapists, school administrators

item.itunes:author: LWTears
item.itunes:summary: Dive into foundational literacy principles with C.C. Bates, focusing on teaching young learners to decode and comprehend text.
